Interface StreamingRadio


  • public interface StreamingRadio
    This abstract data type represents the backend for a streaming radio service. It stores the songs, stations, and users in the system, as well as the ratings that users assign to songs.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean addSong(Song theSong)
      Adds a new song to the system.
      boolean addToStation(Song theSong, Station theStation)
      Adds an existing song to the playlist for an existing radio station.
      void clearRating(User theUser, Song theSong)
      Clears a user's rating on a song.
      int predictRating(User theUser, Song theSong)
      Predicts the rating a user will assign to a song that they have not yet rated, as a number of stars from 1 to 5.
      boolean rateSong(User theUser, Song theSong, int theRating)
      Sets a user's rating for a song, as a number of stars from 1 to 5.
      boolean removeFromStation(Song theSong, Station theStation)
      Removes a song from the playlist for a radio station.
      boolean removeSong(Song theSong)
      Removes an existing song from the system.
      Song suggestSong(User theUser)
      Suggests a song for a user that they are predicted to like.

    • Method Detail

      • addSong

        boolean addSong(Song theSong)
         throws java.lang.NullPointerException,
                java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Adds a new song to the system. If the requested song to add is not null, and the system does not already have the song, then the song will be added to the system. This method will return true if the song was sucessfully added to the system; false if the system already has the song. If the song to be added does not exist, then an IllegalArgumentException will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        theSong - the song to be added.
        Returns:
        true if the song was successfully added to the system; will return false if the system already has the song.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the song to be added is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the song to be added does not exist.

      • removeSong

        boolean removeSong(Song theSong)
            throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Removes an existing song from the system. If the song to be removed exists within the system (has been added and has NOT been removed already), then it will be removed from the system and the method will return true. If the song requested to be removed does not exist within the system, then the method will return false. If the requested song to be removed is null, then a NullPointerException will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        theSong - song to be removed.
        Returns:
        true if the song was sucessfully removed; false if the song could not be found within the system.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the requested song to be removed is null.

      • addToStation

        boolean addToStation(Song theSong,
                     Station theStation)
              throws java.lang.NullPointerException,
                     java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Adds an existing song to the playlist for an existing radio station. The playlist should accept multiples of the same song. If the song to be added exists within the system, then the song will be added to the playlist and the method will return true. The method will return false if the song does not exist within the system. If the song or the station is null, then a NullPointerException will be thrown. If the station does not exist, then an IllegalArgumentException will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        theSong - song to be added to the station.
        theStation - station to which the song will be added.
        Returns:
        true if the song was sucessfully added to the playlist; false if the song does not exist within the system.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the added song is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the station does not exist.

      • removeFromStation

        boolean removeFromStation(Song theSong,
                          Station theStation)
                   throws java.lang.NullPointerException,
                          java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Removes a song from the playlist for a radio station. If the song to be removed exists within the playlist (has been added and has NOT been removed already), then the song is removed from the playlist and the method will return true. If the requested song does not exist within the playlist, then the method will return false. If the requested song or station is null, then a NullPointerException will be thrown. If the station does not exist, then an IllegalArgumentException will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        theSong - song to be removed.
        theStation - station from which the song will be removed.
        Returns:
        true if the song was sucessfully removed; false if the song could not be found within the playlist.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the requested song or the station is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the station does not exist.

      • rateSong

        boolean rateSong(User theUser,
                 Song theSong,
                 int theRating)
          throws java.lang.NullPointerException,
                 java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Sets a user's rating for a song, as a number of stars from 1 to 5. If the user has already rated the song, this method should be able to override the current rating and will return true if a rating was assigned to a specific song under a specific user. This method will return false if the song does not exist within the system. An IllegalArgumentException will be thrown if the rating is less than 0 or greater than 5. It will also throw a NullPointerException if either the user, song, or rating is null.
        Parameters:
        theUser - user from which the rating originates.
        theSong - song to be rated.
        theRating - rating value of the song.
        Returns:
        true if the rating was sucessfully set, false if the song does not exist within the system.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the rating is greater than 5 or less than 0.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the user, song, or rating null.

      • clearRating

        void clearRating(User theUser,
                 Song theSong)
          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                 java.lang.NullPointerException
        Clears a user's rating on a song. If this user has rated this song and the rating has not already been cleared, then the rating is cleared and the state will appear as if the rating was never made. If there is no such rating on record (either because this user has not rated this song, or because the rating has already been cleared), then this method will throw an IllegalArgumentException.
        Parameters:
        theUser - user whose rating should be cleared
        theSong - song from which the user's rating should be cleared
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the user does not currently have a rating on record for the song
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if either the user or the song is null

      • predictRating

        int predictRating(User theUser,
                  Song theSong)
           throws java.lang.NullPointerException,
                  java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Predicts the rating a user will assign to a song that they have not yet rated, as a number of stars from 1 to 5. Upon sucessful rating prediction, this method will return the value of the predicted rating. If the user has already rated the song, this method will return -1. It will throw a NullPointerException if either the user the song is null. It will throw a IllegalArgumentException if the song does not exist within the system.
        Parameters:
        theUser - user for whom a rating will be predicted.
        theSong - song to which that rating will be assigned.
        Returns:
        integer value of the rating.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if either the user or the song is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the song does not exist within the system.

      • suggestSong

        Song suggestSong(User theUser)
          throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Suggests a song for a user that they are predicted to like. If the predicted user rating of a song in the system is greater than 3, then this method will return that song. If there is no song in the System for which the users predicted rating is greater than 3, then this method will return null. If the user is null, then a NullPointerException will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        theUser - user to which a song will be suggested.
        Returns:
        suggested song.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the user is null.
